FacilityName: Freeport LNG Storage and Trucking Facility

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY 2016 RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM UPDATE

A Risk Management Program has been implemented at the Freeport Liquid Natural Gas (LNG), Oyster Creek, Texas natural gas Storage and Trucking Facility (STF) to reduce the risk of accidental releases of hazardous materials. This Risk Management Plan summarizes the management, administrative, procedural and technological controls that work together to minimize the risk of hazardous chemical releases to the community.

FREEPORT LNG POLICIES FOR HEALTH, ENVIRONMENT AND SAFETY

Risk management and safety are core principles at Freeport LNG. Freeport LNG is committed to conducting its operations in a safe, responsible manner and to reduce risks to health and the environment.
Commitment to environment, health, and safety (EHS) starts with the CEO. Senior management routinely dedicates time to review EHS matters. Emphasis on safety is carried through to the facility level, where the Plant Manager and the Safety Department regularly review safety performance, take corrective actions and strive for continuous improvement. Freeport LNG's EHS programs include policies, procedures, standards, and guidance materials designed to fulfill Freeport LNG's commitment to health, environment and safety. These materials include Risk Management Program guidance to assist our facilities to prevent and/or reduce the risk of accidents. Should an accidental hazardous substance release occur, we also have implemented a comprehensive Emergency Response Program to promptly respond, address, and minimize the consequences of the release.

FACILITY IDENTIFICATION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES IN COVERED PROCESSES

The Freeport LNG natural gas Storage and Trucking Facility is located at 1914 FM 523 , Oyster Creek, Texas. The facility will receive Natural Gas Liquid (NGL) through an underground pipeline from the Freeport LNG Pretreatment Facility approximately 1 Mile to the north.
